description: {"blocks":[{"key":"73jtk","text":"Protocol for the preparation of decontaminated (i.e., nuclease-treated) Adapter/splinter mix for the first adapter ligation in automated single-stranded DNA library preparation using the ssDNA2.0 method (Gansauge et al. 2020). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agr1s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1r07r","text":"References","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gnkg","text":"Gansauge, M.-T., Aximu-Petri, A., Nagel, S., \u0026 Meyer, M. (2020). Manual and automated preparation of single-stranded DNA libraries for the sequencing of DNA from ancient biological remains and other sources of highly degraded DNA. Nature Protocols, 15, 2279-2300.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8k5vj","text":"Note","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fket2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd50f","text":"This protocol describes the preparation of five (or multiples of five) tubes containing Adapter/splinter mix. Each tube suffices for one 96-well library preparation plate (96 + 20 reactions to account for dead volumes and loss of reagent). It is advisable to prepare 2-4 batches (10-20 mixes) at once. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"200ha","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3r85","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjqfk","text":"Materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2r64","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4g2mt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0deo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq9jj","text":"Equipment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8648j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b18r7","text":"Thermal cycler for PCR strip tubes (e.g. Veriti 96-Well fast Thermal Cycler, cat. no. 4375305)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1hmo","text":"Label printer (e.g. Brady M611, cat. no. M611-EU-LABS) and tube labels (e.g. Labels for TLS2200/TLS PC Link/Polyester, cat. no. PTL-82-499)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"948v6","text":"centrifuge for 5 ml tubes (e.g. MyFuge 5 Microcentrifuge, cat. no. 55C1005-E)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1jui","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5nl5k","text":"Protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"otsf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nj91","text":"1. Prepare the following reaction mix for decontamination of adapter oligonucleotide TL181 in a 1.5 ml Eppendorf Safe-lock tube, mix properly by flipping the tube with a finger and briefly spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55ui7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"948rd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ocjh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es94g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49bmi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7q32q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qq47","text":"2. Prepare the following reaction mix for decontamination of splinter oligonucleotide TL159 in a 1.5 ml Eppendorf Safe-lock tube, mix properly by flipping the tube with a finger and briefly spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80fkk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1eku0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eiio5","text":"3. Distribute reaction mix from step 1 to seven wells of a PCR 8-strip tube, adding 50 µl to each well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck9mp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6esfp","text":"4. Distribute reaction mix from step 2 to seven wells of another PCR 8-strip tube, adding 50 µl to each well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eruf2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8auq9","text":"5. In a thermal cycler, incubate both PCR 8-strip tubes for 20 min at 37°C, followed by 1 min at 95°C  to inactivate the enzymes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9oba2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ot1b","text":"6. Transfer the content of strip-tube 1 to strip-tube 2 (100 µl final volume each well) and mix by vortexing. Briefly spin tubes down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avl63","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fl4ah","text":"7. In a thermal cycler, incubate the strip-tube at 95°C for 10 s and cool down to 10°C at a rate of 0.1°C/s. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpm81","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cppr","text":"8. Combine the content of all wells in a 5 ml screw-cap tube (final volume 700 µl). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dep2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e27gq","text":"9. Add 2,660 µl of water and 140 µl of 2% Tween-20 solution to obtain Adapter/splinter mix at a concentration of 2/4 µM in a final volume of 3.5 ml. Mix well by vortexing. Briefly spin tubes down in a 5 ml table centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqhki","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63tlt","text":"10. Distribute Adapter/splinter mix from step 9 to five 5 ml screw-cap tubes by adding 690 µl to each tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfj1v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fmeo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lilt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d64cq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tg4","text":"11. Freeze at -20 °C until used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er1r2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kr6s","text":" Scientific","NUNC374320-BR","-"]],"guid":"2164199482BF4F239A71C1D6046E7BAC","height":0,"isJexcelDataFormat":true,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eaom2","text":"* Decontamination of reagents and consumables should be performed as detailed in the Appendix.
¶ Use to prepare a 2% (vol/vol) solution in water. NOTE: Tween-20 is highly viscous, pipette slowly and with care.
† Order oligonucleotide TL181 at 1µmol synthesis scale (Integrated DNA Technologies, desalted). Dissolve in TE buffer (See document in the Appendix for preparation of this buffer) at a concentration of 100 µM. Sequence: 5'-phosphate-AGATCGGAAGAAA[A][A][A][A][A][A][A]-TEG-biotin-3' ([A] denotes 2'-O-Methyl nucleotides)
‡ Order oligonucleotide TL159 at 1µmol synthesis scale (Eurogentec, desalted). Dissolve in TE buffer (See document in the Appendix for preparation of this buffer) at a concentration of 100 µM. Sequence: 5'-[A][A][A]CTTCCGATCTNNNNNNNN[A]-AmC6-3' ([A] denotes 2'-O-Methyl
